channel.title: Server issue after mass account creation
channel.description:
[Error] Unable to establish loopback connection [Error] [Ljava.lang.StackTraceElement;@4406cef4
i have that in my server client now after someone had created some 500 accounts while i was sleeping. i know who was doing it because he was doing it to us the other night. How can i fix this? i've tried even re dl the entire source and it still won't work. tried using a different source...nothing. please help me with this and maybe give me some ideas on how to keep this from happening in the future.

item.title: Server issue after mass account creation
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

Would be nice if xEnt used e.getMessage() instead of just printing out the pointer…

Read full topic
item.source: Server issue after mass account creation

item.title: Server issue after mass account creation
item.dc:creator: @Lets_PK Lets PK
item.description:
@Lets_PK wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:331786”][quote author=z2 link=topic=426448.msg3133802#msg3133802 date=1266730108]
To keep it from happening you need to set a max amount of characters pr forum accunt or set a throttle inbetween creating ingame characters.
[/quote]
He’s using EasyRSC.

Your options are:

  1. Only allow character registration via a website (and remove registration via the client).
  2. Set a limit between character creation using their IP address to identify them.

There’s been no public release yet to fix this issue but xEnt did it for BeyondRSC so maybe he will post what he did and how he fixed it.

If it was me, I’d personally use no. 1 as I’ve never liked automatic character creation. View the PHP code I posted in Server Development and edit it to allow people to create a character if it doesn’t exist and then completely remove the automatic creation from the client.[/quote]
Yea personally i think no,1 is the best option, I have the same problem, But im looking for someone who is willing to code it for a small fee of $$, since i never expect ANYTHING free.

Read full topic
item.source: Server issue after mass account creation
